history.text: Hello, have you seen the shape of water?
I have not yet seen the Shape of water. Have you?
Yes, it's a really good movie. It's a fantasy/drama film
I have heard really good things about it. It's supposed to be Del Toro's most stunningly successful works and I like his other movies
So that gives me a great motivation to see it eventually.
Yes, its a really good one. It's also got really solid ratings.
The cast seems to be really top notch with a mix of big names and new comers.
Yeah, Rotten Tomatoes gave it a 92%, Metacritic gave it a 87% and CinemaScore gave it a A
That is a really good mix of reviews. The plot seems to be very unique and interesting too. All around it sounds enticing.
Yeah, Sally Hawkins in the lead role is great. She plays a mute cleaner who works at this secret government lab who falls in love with this top secret amphibian creature.
It also sets the stage well with orphaned child scene. It leaves a lot to the imagination and lets you really connect with the character.
Yes, they are able to connect really well because she's mute and he's a creature so they commute in a different way.
*communicate
The sign language is a really good tool to use. It also lets kids and adults who communicate through sign language feel more represented in media which isn't always the case.
The cast is really diverse. Richard Jenkins plays her closeted neighbor who is her best friend, along with Octavia Spenser's character who is her co worker and helps her a lot
The time period is also interesting, setting it during the cold war.
The way she keeps adding salt to the water to make sure the creature lives really shows her character's dedication
Yeah, and she understands him in an unconventional way.
It's a little unnerving seeing the creature eating a cat though. It leads to the revelation of it's powers but it's still a mixed scene for me.
Yeah, it is a but of a disturbing scene, but luckily they understand that he wasn't really trying to hurt anyone, he just didn't understand and he was hungry.
definitely. It reveals the creature is just being itself and doesn't know any better. They understand that
I know a lot of people had mixed feelings about it, but I did think it was romantic in a way that she flooded her bathroom just so they could be intimate together.
yeah it was a powerful scene
When the creature starts getting sick it really makes you feel for it.
The villain of the movie, Strickland, is a pretty intimidating antagonist the way he hunts them
and with how he injures the creature. Thankfully he manages to heal himself
Its wonderful they lived happily ever after though, we rarely get that in movies nowadays.
Yes, and it was good to see the bad guy get what he deserved in the end.
Yes, he got exactly what we all wanted
I loved how he took her into the water and healed her and gave her gills so they could be together
